# React to Solid Porting Guide

This documentation provides a comprehensive guide for porting React hooks and components to SolidJS, based on the patterns found in @mantine-hooks (React) and @bagon-hooks (Solid).

## Core Concepts

- [State vs Signals](/concepts/state-vs-signals.md)
  - Mapping `useState` to `createSignal`.
  - Understanding read/write separation.

- [Effects & Lifecycle](/concepts/effects-and-lifecycle.md)
  - Mapping `useEffect` to `createEffect`.
  - Auto-tracking dependencies vs manual dependency arrays.
  - `onCleanup` vs returning a cleanup function.

- [Props & Accessors](/concepts/props-and-accessors.md)
  - **CRITICAL**: Passing reactive values vs passing functions.
  - Why `props.value` loses reactivity if destructured.

- [Refs & DOM](/concepts/refs-and-dom.md)
  - `useRef` vs plain variables or `createSignal`.
  - Handling ref callbacks.

- [Callbacks & Stability](/concepts/callbacks-and-stability.md)
  - Why `useCallback` is rarely needed.
  - The "Run Once" component model explained.

- [Stores vs Reducers](/concepts/stores-vs-reducers.md)
  - Replacing `useReducer` and complex state with `createStore`.
  - Mutating state with proxies (Immer-like style).
